intro: Hieracium ascendens, commonly known as the ascending hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as meadows and roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium ascendens is often found in temperate climates and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
